meanings.definition: A type of cell found in the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: Athrocytes are important cells in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study athrocytes to understand the brain better.
meanings.sent3: The athrocytes in the brain throw a party when they receive important signals.
meanings.sent4: In the intricate network of the brain, athrocytes act as diligent messengers.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, athrocytes look like tiny stars in the brain galaxy.

meanings.definition: Cells that provide support and protection for neurons.
meanings.sent1: Neurons rely on athrocytes for protection.
meanings.sent2: Athrocytes form a shield around neurons to keep them safe.
meanings.sent3: The athrocytes are like bodyguards for the neurons, always watching out for danger.
meanings.sent4: In the neural fortress, athrocytes stand strong against any threats to the neurons.
meanings.sent5: The relationship between neurons and athrocytes is like a loyal friendship in the brain.

meanings.definition: Cells that help maintain the blood-brain barrier.
meanings.sent1: Athrocytes play a crucial role in protecting the brain from harmful substances.
meanings.sent2: The blood-brain barrier is fortified by the presence of athrocytes.
meanings.sent3: When it comes to guarding the brain, athrocytes take their job very seriously.
meanings.sent4: Athrocytes are the vigilant gatekeepers of the brain's defense system.
meanings.sent5: The blood-brain barrier owes its strength to the unwavering dedication of athrocytes.
